p: Antioxidant activity was determined by 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) free radical scavenging and β-carotene bleaching methods. The 50% inhibitory concentration (IC 50) were calculated and the IC 50 values are presented in Table 3. Quercetin and Ginkgo biloba extract were employed as positive controls showing IC 50 2.5 ± 0.09 and 13.5 ± 0.5 μg/mL, respectively, for DPPH assay, while butylhydroxytoluene (BHT) and butylhydroxyanisole (BHA) were the positive controls for β-carotene assay, showing IC 50 0.08 ± 0.09 and 0.27 ± 0.02 μg/mL, respectively.
